intro: Viola brockmanniana, commonly known as the Dutch violet, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to the Netherlands and is characterized by its heart-shaped, dark green leaves and striking violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and blooms, which appear in late spring to early summer. Viola brockmanniana is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
